publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2895 Michael Russell: The Hollies 2002 Appeal-That the Parliament recognises the benefit to the people of East Lothian and Musselburgh provided by the Hollies Day Centre in Musselburgh; thanks the volunteers and other workers who give so much time and effort to make the centre a success, and encourages individuals, organisations and businesses to support the 2002 Appeal from the Centre which aims to raise sufficient funds to construct purpose-built day care accommodation for frail and elderly pensioners and run a specially adapted minibus.

S1M-2895 Michael Russell: The Hollies 2002 Appealâ€”That the Parliament recognises the benefit to the people of East Lothian and Musselburgh provided by the Hollies Day Centre in Musselburgh; thanks the volunteers and other workers who give so much time and effort to make the centre a success, and encourages individuals, organisations and businesses to support the 2002 Appeal from the Centre which aims to raise sufficient funds to construct purpose-built day care accommodation for frail and elderly pensioners and run a specially adapted minibus.
S1M-2895 The Hollies 2002 Appeal (lodged on 13 March 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-2895 The Hollies 2002 Appeal (lodged on 13 March 2002) Alex Neil*, Christine Grahame*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2895 The Hollies 2002 Appeal (lodged on 13 March 2002) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-2895 The Hollies 2002 Appeal (lodged on 13 March 2002) Ms Sandra White*, Tricia Marwick*
